file_content.text: "And so it is with great regret that I inform you that your son has... died like an incompetent--" no....
I found the Organa transport. It was packed with war droids, but they won't be a problem anymore.
War droids? Well, that explains a few things.
Outstanding work on your part. Handled those droids before we even realized they were a threat. If only the Thuls had been so useful.
Speaking of which, I suppose it's up to me to convey the Empire's condolences over their passing. That won't be awkward.
The snow should have melted enough for you to check out that transport. Let me know what you find.
My lord, I need your help. I've had it with these Thuls!
Sir, you must do something. These Thuls are useless!
Those blasted Thuls have failed us for the last time!
Always pestering me, begging me to send them off on some vital mission.
I finally caved, allowed some of them to investigate a crashed Organa transport. Two days, and still no word from them.
They're noblemen. What did you expect?
Of course they failed.
I don't know... a shred of competence?
You suspect something?
It's a transport--a broken one, at that. Should've been a breeze.
Who cares?
I don't give a toss about the Thuls either, but that ship may be important.
My men downed the vessel a few days ago. It crashed somewhere nearby, buried under a mountain of snow.
I asked for someone to investigate the wreckage when the snow thawed, and those twits volunteered. Like an idiot, I allowed it.
They were weak. The transport is our only concern.
Forget the Thuls.
Couldn't agree more.
It's high time the Thuls started carrying their own weight.
It was the right call.
Makes you wonder how they ever got by without us here to hold their hands.
That's why you don't send a bunch of blue bloods to do a soldier's job.
Should've used a professional.
Lesson learned.
You could have said "no."
Why didn't you refuse?
I thought I was throwing them a bone.
Any idea what the transport was carrying?
What's in the wreckage?
Could be anything: weapons, supplies, someone's wardrobe....
They're probably just lost.
If they were still alive, we'd have heard something, a distress call, anything.
It's possible the Organas were bringing in something dangerous. With the Thuls not responding, that seems to imply that it was important.
I'll pick up the Thuls' slack.
I'm sure you'll have more success than those dandies.
I'll check it out.
The crash site isn't far. Check the wreckage, find out what the Organas were transporting, and maybe we'll solve this mystery.
Do it yourself. [Refuse quest]
Very well. I'm sure there are plenty more noblemen dying to prove themselves.
Do we really need the Thuls?
